title: Rocky the Early Rooster
story:
Rocky the rooster had an important job - to wake up the farm every morning! Every day at sunrise, Rocky would crow 'Cock-a-doodle-doo!' loudly to wake everyone up.

One day, Rocky was tired and wanted to sleep more. But he remembered everyone was counting on him. Rocky got up and crowed his morning call. All the animals thanked him for being so responsible!
lesson: Being responsible means doing our job even when we don't feel like it. Others depend on us!

title: Rocky's Sharing Corn
story:
Rocky found a big pile of corn kernels. He could eat them all by himself, but he saw his friends were hungry too.

Rocky called all his chicken friends: 'Come share this corn with me!' Everyone ate together and had plenty. Rocky learned that sharing makes everyone happy, including himself!
lesson: When we share what we have, everyone gets enough and we make more friends!

title: The Proud Rooster
story:
Rocky had beautiful red feathers and thought he was the most handsome rooster ever. He bragged to everyone: 'Look how beautiful I am!'

One day, Rocky got muddy and his feathers were dirty. His friends still loved him! Rocky learned that being kind is more important than being pretty. He stopped bragging and became a humble rooster.
lesson: Being humble and kind is more important than looking good or bragging about ourselves!

title: Rocky Helps Baby Chick
story:
Rocky saw a tiny baby chick who couldn't reach the food. The chick was too small and looked sad.

Rocky used his beak to push some food closer to the baby chick. The little chick chirped happily and ate! Mama hen thanked Rocky for being so helpful and kind.
lesson: Helping those who are smaller or need help is a wonderful thing to do!

title: The Brave Rooster
story:
Rocky heard a strange noise near the henhouse. He was scared, but he knew he had to protect his friends.

Rocky puffed up his chest and crowed loudly: 'Cock-a-doodle-doo!' The noise was just the farmer's dog being friendly. Rocky was brave even though he was scared, and everyone felt safe because of him.
lesson: Being brave means doing what's right even when we're scared. Courage keeps others safe!

title: Rocky Learns to Listen
story:
Mama hen told Rocky: 'Don't go near the fox's den.' But Rocky didn't listen. He thought he knew better.

Rocky wandered close to the fox's den and got scared! He ran back quickly. Rocky learned that listening to wise advice keeps us safe. Now Rocky always listens to Mama hen!
lesson: Listening to parents and elders is important. They give advice to keep us safe!

title: The Patient Rooster
story:
Rocky wanted to fly to the top of the barn, but he couldn't reach it in one jump. He kept trying and trying but got frustrated.

Rocky's friend told him: 'Try jumping to each step slowly.' Rocky practiced patiently, one step at a time. After many days, Rocky could reach the top! Patience helped him succeed.
lesson: Being patient and practicing helps us learn new things. Good things take time!

title: Rocky's Kind Words
story:
A new chicken came to the farm and felt lonely. All the chickens ignored her except Rocky.

Rocky said: 'Hello! Welcome to our farm. Want to be friends?' The new chicken smiled and felt happy. Rocky's kind words made her feel welcomed. Soon everyone became friends!
lesson: Kind words make others feel good. Welcoming new friends is important!

title: Rocky Says Sorry
story:
Rocky accidentally stepped on his friend's tail while running. His friend got upset and walked away.

Rocky felt bad. He ran to his friend and said: 'I'm sorry I stepped on your tail. I didn't mean to.' His friend forgave him and they played together again. Saying sorry fixed their friendship!
lesson: When we make mistakes, saying sorry helps fix things. It's brave to apologize!

title: The Honest Rooster
story:
Rocky accidentally broke the water bowl. He could hide it, but he knew that was wrong.

Rocky went to the farmer and clucked to show what happened. The farmer wasn't angry because Rocky was honest. The farmer said: 'Thank you for being truthful, Rocky!' and fixed the bowl.
lesson: Being honest is always the right choice. People trust us when we tell the truth!

title: Rocky's Clean Coop
story:
Rocky's corner of the coop was messy with feathers everywhere. It was uncomfortable to sleep there.

Rocky decided to clean his space. He organized his area and removed old feathers. Now his corner was neat and cozy! Rocky slept better in his clean space.
lesson: Keeping our space clean makes us feel better. A tidy place is a happy place!

title: The Friendly Rooster
story:
Rocky made friends with everyone on the farm - chickens, ducks, even the shy rabbit. He was friendly to all.

When Rocky needed help reaching food one day, all his friends came to help! Rocky learned that being friendly to everyone means you'll have many friends when you need them.
lesson: Being friendly to everyone means you'll have lots of friends. Friends help each other!

title: Rocky's Loud Voice
story:
Rocky loved to crow loudly all the time. But when baby chicks were sleeping, his loud crowing woke them up.

Mama hen asked Rocky: 'Please be quiet when babies sleep.' Rocky learned to crow softly during nap time. Everyone appreciated Rocky's thoughtfulness!
lesson: Sometimes being quiet is important. We should respect quiet times and sleeping friends!

title: The Thankful Rooster
story:
Every day, the farmer gave Rocky food and water. Rocky never said thank you.

One day, Rocky started clucking happily when the farmer came. The farmer smiled and gave Rocky extra treats! Rocky learned that showing thanks makes everyone happy.
lesson: Being thankful for what we have is important. Saying thank you makes others feel appreciated!

title: Rocky's Safe Choices
story:
Rocky wanted to explore outside the fence, but he knew it wasn't safe. The big road with cars was nearby.

Rocky stayed inside the fence where it was safe. His friends who went outside almost got hurt! Rocky's safe choice kept him healthy and happy.
lesson: Making safe choices protects us from danger. We should stay in safe places!

title: The Hardworking Rooster
story:
Rocky had to scratch the ground to find food. It was hard work, but Rocky kept trying.

Some chickens gave up and waited for easy food. But Rocky found the best seeds because he worked hard! His hard work gave him the tastiest meals.
lesson: Working hard helps us get good results. Don't give up when things are difficult!

title: Rocky's Turn to Play
story:
All the chickens wanted to use the dust bath at the same time. Rocky pushed his way in first.

But then Rocky felt bad. He said: 'Let's take turns!' Everyone got to use the dust bath. Taking turns made everyone happy and no one had to wait too long.
lesson: Taking turns is fair. When we share and wait our turn, everyone gets a chance!

title: The Gentle Rooster
story:
Rocky was big and strong, but sometimes he was too rough when playing with baby chicks.

Mama hen said: 'Please be gentle with the babies.' Rocky learned to play softly and carefully. Now the baby chicks loved playing with gentle Rocky!
lesson: Being gentle is important, especially with those smaller than us. Gentle play is safe play!

title: Rocky Tries Again
story:
Rocky tried to catch a grasshopper but missed. He tried again and missed. He wanted to give up.

But Rocky kept trying. On his tenth try, Rocky caught the grasshopper! He learned that not giving up helps us succeed. Practice makes perfect!
lesson: Never give up! If we keep trying, we can do hard things. Perseverance leads to success!

title: The Respectful Rooster
story:
Rocky always respected the wise old rooster. He waited quietly when the old rooster was speaking and never interrupted.

The old rooster taught Rocky many things because Rocky was so respectful. Rocky became wise too because he showed respect to his elders!
lesson: Respecting elders and others is important. When we show respect, we learn valuable lessons!

title: Rocky's Happy Song
story:
Every morning, Rocky crowed a happy song. His cheerful 'Cock-a-doodle-doo!' made everyone smile.

Even on rainy days, Rocky's happy crow brightened everyone's mood. The farm animals loved Rocky because his joy was contagious. Being happy made others happy too!
lesson: Spreading happiness and joy makes the world brighter. Our cheerfulness can make others happy!

title: Rocky Obeys Rules
story:
The farmer made a rule: 'Stay away from the garden.' Rocky wanted to go there, but he obeyed the rule.

Other chickens went to the garden and ate poison plants. They got sick! Rocky stayed healthy because he followed the rules. Rules keep us safe!
lesson: Following rules keeps us safe and healthy. Rules are made to protect us!

title: The Forgiving Rooster
story:
Another rooster accidentally ate Rocky's favorite corn. Rocky was angry at first.

But then Rocky remembered times when he made mistakes too. He said: 'It's okay, I forgive you.' They became best friends! Forgiveness brought peace and friendship.
lesson: Forgiving others makes us feel better. Everyone makes mistakes, and forgiveness brings peace!

title: Rocky's Big Dream
story:
Rocky dreamed of being the best rooster ever - waking everyone on time, helping others, and being kind.

Rocky worked every day toward his dream. He practiced his crow, helped friends, and stayed positive. Rocky's dream came true because he worked hard and never gave up!
lesson: Following our dreams takes work and patience. If we try hard, our dreams can come true!

title: The Loving Rooster
story:
Rocky loved his family and showed it every day. He protected them, shared food with them, and made them feel special.

Rocky's family loved him back. They all stayed close and took care of each other. Love made their family strong and happy!
lesson: Showing love to family and friends is the most important thing. Love makes everyone feel special and safe!
